intro: Reevesia lofouensis, commonly known as the Lofouense reevesia, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Reevesia lofouensis typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
